column4: i've got speaker-test -Dplug:surround51 -c6 -l1 -twav playing all channels, but when i play music i can't get it to play out the rear speakers (pulse audio and audigy2)
I think I saw the pulseaudio wiki mention that, but I don't know if it applies to ubuntu.
http://www.pulseaudio.org/wiki/FAQ#IhaveasurroundsoundcardbutPulseAudiousesjustthefrontspeakers but you should definitely ask for a second opinion, I'm not familiar with ubuntu's pulse setup
thanks, also, i just got it to work with OSS, should i just settle for that, or is there a real benefit for getting pulseaudio working?
it may be a bit of a hassle to get rid of it completely on an ubuntu system (it integrates in a couple of places afaik).
and in some cases it may actually be useful, especially if you're on a laptop with multiple outputs or ever want to output over the network.
thanks for the link, i actually made that edit from help i found elsewhere, but hadn't restarted pulseaudio, gonna try that now
W: alsa-util.c: Device hw:0 doesn't support 6 channels, changed to 2.
huh, odd. Do you have multiple devices?
ohwow, just put on a flash vid and it's coming out the rear speakers too!
hmm, music's working too now, sounds like i've got it for now.
hmm, sounds like you somehow need "Device 3" instead of the first one
maybe, but it seems to be working on all the speakers now :3
